\section{Module saip.controllers.error}

    \label{saip:controllers:error}
Error controller


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%%                           Class Description                           %%
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

    \index{saip \textit{(package)}!saip.controllers \textit{(package)}!saip.controllers.error \textit{(module)}!saip.controllers.error.ErrorController \textit{(class)}|(}
\subsection{Class ErrorController}

    \label{saip:controllers:error:ErrorController}
\begin{tabular}{cccccc}
% Line for object, linespec=[False]
\multicolumn{2}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{object}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{object}}
&&
  \\\cline{3-3}
  &&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
  \\
&&\multicolumn{2}{l}{\textbf{saip.controllers.error.ErrorController}}
\end{tabular}

Generates error documents as and when they are required.

The ErrorDocuments middleware forwards to ErrorController when error 
related status codes are returned from the application.

This behaviour can be altered by changing the parameters to the 
ErrorDocuments middleware in your config/middleware.py file.
